quotes.quote: Before the reward there must be labor. You plant before you harvest. You sow in tears before you reap joy.
The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.
The highest reward that God gives us for good work is the ability to do better work.
The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.

This is the great reward of service, to live, far out and on, in the life of others; this is the mystery of Christ, - to give life's best for such high sake that it shall be found again unto life eternal.
The reward of labour is life. Is that not enough?
The reward of great men is that, long after they have died, one is not quite sure that they are dead.
The big rewards come to those who travel the second, undemanded mile.
There are grand rewards for those who pick the high hard roads, but those rewards are hidden by years.
The reward for conformity is that everyone likes you but yourself.
To give without any reward, or any notice, has a special quality of its own.
You don't reward reaction; you reward results.
The reward of art is not fame or success but intoxication: that is why so many bad artists are unable to give it up.
The reward of energy, enterprise and thrift is taxes.
The reward of pain is experience.
A reward once given becomes a right.
There's no reward in life without risk.
The rewards of virtue alone abide secure.
The hope of reward is the solace of labor.
The final reward of the dead - to die no more.
Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
Every kind of reward constitutes a degradation of energy.
No eternal reward will forgive us now for wasting the dawn.
The greatest rewards come only from the greatest commitment.
The reward of our work is not what we get, but what we become.
You can best reward a liar by believing nothing of what he says.
There is sufficient reward in the mere consciousness of a good action.
The reward of one duty is the power to fulfill another.
The tougher the job, the greater the reward.
To me, there's no greater reward than being around people you care about and can be present with.
